About Me...

I’m a rising senior at Yale University, where I’m studying economics. I care deeply about addressing economic inequality, so I’ve focused on studying tax policy, welfare, and community development. I have experience in direct service, academic research, and public policy. I’m always looking for opportunities to give my time and energy to causes helping low- and moderate-income families. Recently, I have started as an intern for{" "} Prosperity Now , where I’m working on the Policy Team to contribute to research on federal policies affecting low- and moderate-income families. In April, I was recognized as a member of the{" "} 2020 Class of Truman Scholars . I have also just finished a stint as a site coordinator for “Virtual VITA,” an alternative tax preparation service developed by me and my dear friend and VITA co-coordinator, Tylar Bloch. If you’re interested in getting in touch with me, please don’t hesitate to reach out! You can send me an{" "} email {" "} or connect with me on{" "} LinkedIn.

My Backstory

I am a proud Kansan and Child of Deaf Adults (CODA). I was raised by two Deaf parents, and my first language is American Sign Language. In my first year of high school, my father passed away from cancer. My mother is a first-generation Cuban-American, and I take great pride in being Cuban. My family, both immediate and extended, has faced a variety of economic hardships. From my grandmother traveling to America from Cuba to build a new life to my own mother working hard to make ends meet, I understand some of the consequences of economic instability. Now, I am a student at Yale University. I have my family, my friends, the Leadership Enterprise for a Diverse America, the Jack Kent Cooke Foundation, and the Truman Foundation to thank for my growth over time.

Books

  • The Yellow House Sarah M. Broom
  • Franchise Marcia Chatelain
  • Atomic Habits James Clear
  • Excellent Sheep William Deresiewicz
  • A House in the Sky Amanda Lindhout & Sara Corbett

Movies & TV Shows

  • Mrs. America
  • Westworld
  • Pulp Fiction
  • The Big Short
  • Gangs of New York

Nonprofits

  • Prosperity Now
  • Center on Budget and Policy Priorities
  • Institute on Taxation & Economic Policy
  • MicroGrants
  • Tax Policy Center
